SEint fraunce&ydot;s Fraunceys þe frere Menour menour &punctelev; þat guod man wa&slong; inovȝ
Marchaunt he wa&slong; in hi&slong; ȝonghede &punctelev; and to eche treuwene&slong;&slong;e d&rrot;ovȝ
his
Marchaundi&slong;e marchaundise
marchaundise he maude a da&ydot; &punctelev; in þe cite of A&slong;i&slong;e
And in alme&slong;dede he &slong;pendede an and on pouere Men men &punctelev; muchedel i&slong; M&rabar;chaundi&slong;e marchaundise
Fo&rrot; no loue of catel &punctelev; he it nolde bileue·
Ȝwane ani pouere man him bede &punctelev; bote he him &slong;omȝwat ȝeue
¶A&slong;e he cam a da&ydot; bi þe wei &punctelev; he gan mieten bi cas
Ane kniȝt þat hadde Riche riche ibeo &punctelev; and and
&slong;wiþe apouered waz
vuele he wa&slong; icloþed al&slong;o &punctelev; and bad him &slong;um guod
Seint fraunce&ydot;s Fraunceys hadde reuþe of him &punctelev; and one ȝw&ydot;le he with&slong;tod
¶ he &slong;trepte of is cloþes of is rug &punctelev; and ȝaf þi&slong; pouere kn&ydot;ȝt
And þeraftur a&slong;e he la&ydot; aslepe &punctelev; in is bedde an&ydot;ȝt
A swiþe noble pale&ydot;s &punctelev; him þouȝte þat he i&slong;eiȝ
he Axede axede
wa&slong; wat þat pale&ydot;s were &punctelev; þat &slong;o riche wa&slong; and heiȝ
Men &slong;eiden him þat it wa&slong; his &punctelev; and i&slong; kniȝtes al&slong;o
Þo þis holie Man man awok &punctelev; &slong;umȝwat he þouȝte do
In þat pale&ydot;&slong; him þouȝte he &slong;aiȝ al&slong;o &punctelev; kn&ydot;ȝhte&slong; Arme&slong; armes
þ⁁e&rrot;ee þere The final word of the line was initially written "þreo". The scribe seems to have added a an "e" after the thorn and subpointed the final "o" before giving up, lining through the whole word, and then rewriting it. This process requires some complex embedded encoding which may be difficult to render.
And with a fair creoiz þo&rrot;uȝout &punctelev; Imarkede imarkede alle hu&ydot; were
¶Þouȝte he o&rrot;e louerd it wole &punctelev; þat ich mi&slong;eolf kn&ydot;ȝt beo
And &slong;w&ydot;þe feble ich am þareto &punctelev; bote ich me bet bi&slong;eo
An Eo&rrot;l eorl þare wa&slong; in poilePoile &punctelev; þat wa&slong; co&rrot;te&ydot;&slong; and hende
he þouȝte kn&ydot;ȝt beo imaud of him &punctelev; þuderward he gan wende
A&slong;e he wende towar toward þis Eo&rrot;l eorl &punctelev; fo&rrot;to beo imaud kniȝt
Ore &slong;wete louerd in Aui&slong;ion auision &punctelev; to him cam a niȝth
Seiȝe me he &slong;eide of þe louerd &punctelev; and of þe h&ydot;ne also
And of þe riche man and of þe pouere &punctelev; ȝwuch ma&ydot; þe me&slong;t guod do
Bote þe louerd quath þis oþur &punctelev; and he þat is riche
Þou hadde&slong;t alme&slong;t icho&slong;e o&rrot;e louerd &slong;eide &punctelev; þat ful oniliche
Fo&rrot; tru&slong;te of þe h&ydot;ne &punctelev; þene louerd þou fo&rrot;&slong;oke
Þov nome vuele þin Avi&slong;ion avision &punctelev; þou mo&slong;t þe bet biloke
¶Þe Armure armure and þe paleis &punctelev; þat þou &slong;o noble i&slong;eiȝe
Elle&slong;ȝware þov &slong;chalt finde &punctelev; Ake ake þou ne come&slong;t nouȝt ȝuit &slong;o heiȝe
Kn&ydot;ȝte&slong; þov &slong;chalt habbe onder þe &punctelev; þulke Arme&slong; armes fo&rrot;to lede
Þarefo&rrot;e wend þe hom aȝein &punctelev; and biþench bet þi dede
¶Þis holi man þo he awok &punctelev; aȝein wende to A&slong;i&slong;e
And þouȝte al on Ihu&combtilde; Ihesu
cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; and bilefde is Marchaundi&slong;e marchaundise
And bad o&rrot;e louerd n&ydot;ȝht and dai &punctelev; þat he &slong;cholde him rede
And &slong;ome tokningue &slong;enden him &punctelev; hov he &slong;cholde is lijf lede

¶Ada&ydot; a&slong;e þi&slong; holie man &punctelev; withoute A&slong;i&slong;e him d&rrot;ouȝ
he mette a lodlich Me&slong;el mesel &punctelev; þat revlich wa&slong; inouȝ
And bad him &slong;um guod fo&rrot; gode&slong; Godes loue &punctelev; seint fraunce&ydot;&slong; Fraunceys aliȝhte
And biclupte and cu&slong;te þane &slong;ike man &punctelev; a&slong;e faire a&slong;e he miȝhte
And of is &slong;eluer him tok &punctelev; and bad him habbe guod da&ydot;
Þo nu&slong;te he ȝware he wa&slong; bicome &punctelev; ne in none &slong;tude him ne &slong;a&ydot;
¶Þo þouȝte wel ho it wa&slong; &punctelev; and aftur þulke dede
he wep and cride on ih&combcurl;u Ihesu
cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; þat he &slong;cholde him &slong;umȝwat rede
And ofte he wolde bi co&slong;tome &punctelev; to Me&slong;eles meseles fare
And &slong;echen heom at heo&rrot;e owene hous &punctelev; bote he founde hem ellesȝware
And cu&slong;&slong;e heo&rrot;e hondene and heo&rrot;e fet &punctelev; and heo&rrot;e Mouth mouth
als also
And ȝ&ydot;ue heom guod wel largeliche &punctelev; bi co&slong;tome he wolde it doalsThe word "als" is added in a later hand to indicate that the line is supposed to rhyme with the last word of the preceding or to be read be read as part of the line itself.
¶Bi a churche of seint Seint
Damian &punctelev; a da&ydot; he cam gon
Þat ope þe po&ydot;nte wa&slong; to falle adoun &punctelev; In in he wende anon
And kneolede adoun bifo&rrot;e þe croiz &punctelev; a&slong;e he dude wel ofte
Þo &slong;pac a voiz þareinne &punctelev; wel Mildeliche mildeliche and &slong;ofte
And &slong;eide fraunce&ydot;s Fraunceys go þe fo&rrot;th &punctelev; and arer up min hou&slong; an heiȝ
Þat þou sixt fallez to grounde &punctelev; and al de&slong;tru&ydot;d is neiȝ
¶ Seint fraunce&ydot;s Fraunceys fo&rrot; þe churche wa&slong; &punctelev; adoneward al ib&rrot;⁁ouȝt
Wende þat o&rrot;e louer louerd þarebi &slong;eide &punctelev; ake þarof na&slong; it nouȝt
he wende and &slong;olde is cloþes anon &punctelev; and muche of is oþur þingue
And þe panes þat he nam þarewith &punctelev; to þis church gan b&rrot;ingue
Þe p&rrot;o&slong;t preost of þe churche he fond þere &punctelev; þe pane&slong; he wolde him take
To arere up þe pouere churche &punctelev; and he heom gan fo&rrot;&slong;ake
he ne do&rrot;&slong;te nouȝt fo&rrot; is fader &punctelev; ne fo&rrot; is oþur freond he &slong;eide
So muche tre&slong;o&rrot; nime of him &punctelev; bote it were bi heo&rrot;e rede
¶ Seint fraunce&ydot;&slong; Fraunceys nam þat tre&slong;o&rrot; &punctelev; þo þe oþur it fo&rrot;&slong;ok
And in a fene&slong;tre leide it þere &punctelev; and in o&rrot;e louerde&slong; warde it tok
Þo þe t&ydot;þingue cam to is fader &punctelev; þat he hadde i&slong;old i&slong; guod
Toward him he wende anon &punctelev; and fo&rrot; wrath wa&slong; neiȝ wod
Seint frauce&ydot;s Fraunceys wa&slong; iwar of him &punctelev; and ne bilefte nouȝt bihinde
he wende and hudde him in a Dich dich &punctelev; þat he ne miȝhte him nouȝt finde
In þis Diche diche wel longue he la&ydot; &punctelev; in hunguer and w&rrot;echhede
And euere cride on Ih&combcurl;u Ihesu
cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; þat he &slong;cholde him betere rede
¶So longue he wa&slong; þare in me&slong;ei&slong;e &punctelev; þat he fo&rrot;ferde neiȝ
Þat vnneþe him couþe iknowe &punctelev; ani man þat him &slong;eiȝ
Atþe la&slong;te in me&slong;ei&slong;e inovȝ &punctelev; he wende to A&slong;i&slong;e
Þat folk þo hu&ydot; &slong;eien him com come &punctelev; heom gan ful &slong;o&rrot;e agri&slong;e
And &slong;eiden here cometh a wod Man man &punctelev; hu&ydot; harleden him wel fa&slong;te
And &slong;miten and pulten here and þere &punctelev; and dunge on him ca&slong;te
¶Seint f&rabar;uncei&slong; Fraunceis
¶wende euere fo&rrot;th &punctelev; a&slong;e þei him
¶noþing nere·
¶Hi&slong; fader cam al&slong;o bi cas &punctelev; and imette him þere ·
he ladde him hom to i&slong; hous &punctelev; and beot him &slong;o&rrot;e inovȝ ·
And bad him b&rrot;ingue hom þat catel &punctelev; þat he er awei d&rrot;ovȝ
Þo he ne miȝhte habbe non oþur wo&rrot;d &punctelev; he bond him &slong;wiþe &slong;trongue
So þat þis guode man &punctelev; in p&rrot;i&slong;one la&ydot; ful longue

Atþe la&slong;te þe ȝw&ydot;le i&slong; fader &punctelev; out of toune gan iwende
his Moder moder hadde reovþe of him &punctelev; and b&rrot;ouȝte him out of bende
Þo he wa&slong; out of bende&slong; ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; he ne bilefte no leng þer
he wende to þe Dich dich aȝein &punctelev; fro ȝwanne&slong; he cam er
¶Þo þis housebonde cam hom &punctelev; and ne founde him nouȝt þere
Swiþe &slong;o&rrot;e he beot is wijf &punctelev; and axede ȝware he were
To þe churche of seint Seint
Damian &punctelev; þe hou&slong;ebonde wende þo
And fond þat tr&slong;so&rrot; al hol þere &punctelev; a&slong;e he it hadde ido
And &slong;ethþe he wende to þe Dich dich &punctelev; and founde i&slong; &slong;one þere
he axede at him fo&rrot; ȝwat þingue &punctelev; þat tre&slong;o&rrot; awei he bere
And þo he i&slong;eiȝ al þen ende &punctelev; þat he lu&ydot;te þarof rouȝte
he ladde f&rabar;unce&ydot;s Fraunceys fo&rrot;th with him &punctelev; ant bifo&rrot;e þe Bi&slong;chop bischop him b&rrot;ouȝte
And bad ȝif he alle&slong; wolde &punctelev; þe wo&rrot;lde&slong; guod bileue

&slong;tod
Þare and bifo&rrot;e god God he ȝaf up &punctelev; al his eo&rrot;þelich guod
And &slong;treopte of is cloþe&slong; &punctelev; anon to i&slong; bare liche
And bifo&rrot;e þe Bi&slong;chope bischope tok is fader &punctelev; and bad him beo guod and riche
he &slong;eide ich þe habbe fader icleoped &punctelev; euere to þis da&ydot;

And to mi fader holde me &punctelev; þat in heuene is

Wo&rrot;lde&slong; guod aftur þulke t&ydot;me &punctelev; ne bod he neuereft non
¶A &slong;eli vplondi&slong;ch&slong;e Man man &punctelev; þat nakede &slong;aiȝ him go
Gret deol in i&slong; heo&rrot;te hadde &punctelev; fo&rrot; is chele and fo&rrot; is wo
he ȝaf him ane olde Mantel mantel &punctelev; his bone&slong; þarewith to hele
Seint f&rabar;uncei&slong; Fraunceis it vnderfeng &punctelev; to witien him fram chele
hi&slong; licame he heolede þarewith &punctelev; and in m&ydot;&slong;ei&slong;e inovȝ
Aȝen þare he wa&slong; ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; to A&slong;i&slong;e he him d&rrot;ovȝ
¶A&slong;e he hadde er ibeo &slong;o riche &punctelev; and &slong;o wel was iknowe
A beggare he cam ad and bad is mete &punctelev; þereaftur in a þ&rrot;owe
Fram do&rrot;e to do&rrot;e he bad is mete &punctelev; and wonede him þarto
Some weren w&rrot;oþe fo&rrot; is dede&slong; &punctelev; and no guod nolden him do

¶To seinte Seinte
Marie in deSert &punctelev; ate la&slong;te he wende wel &slong;tille
And criede on o&rrot;e louerd niȝht and da&ydot; &punctelev; þat he dude bi him is wille

his churche þat adoneward wa&slong; &punctelev; be&slong;t arere up and diȝhte

Þe o&rrot;d&rrot;e of frere Menours menours &punctelev; to &slong;aui mani a man
¶In þe bigu&ydot;nningue of þis o&rrot;d&rrot;e &punctelev; a&slong;e o&rrot;e louerd ȝef þat cas
Ane ma&slong;&slong;e he iheo&rrot;de a da&ydot; &punctelev; þat of þe Apo&slong;tles was
A&slong; man rat ȝu&ydot;t among us &punctelev; in þe god&slong;pelle it &slong;eide þo
Þat o&rrot;e louerd hiet is de&slong;ciple&slong; &punctelev; þo hu&ydot; &slong;cholden aboute go
Þat hu&ydot; ne beren with heom gol gold ne &slong;eluer &punctelev; ȝwane hu&ydot; wenden ouer lond
Ne baggue ne tweie curtle&slong; noþur &punctelev; ne &slong;chon goinde with ouer lond

Þo seint Seint
f&rabar;unceis Fraunceis iheo&rrot;de þis &punctelev; he dude of is &slong;chon
And po&rrot;ueiȝede þat frere Menours menours &punctelev; barefot &slong;cholden gon
Withoute bagge withoute &slong;taf &punctelev; withoute ani þing to &slong;pene
Bote ech frere Menour menour do al&slong;o &punctelev; he ne halt nouȝt is o&rrot;d&rrot;e ich wene
In &slong;tude of is gurdel al&slong;o &punctelev; with rope he him bond
In þis manere frere Menours menours &punctelev; &slong;cholden go ouer lond

To
seint Seint
Nichola&slong; churche hu&ydot; wenden &punctelev; ane ma&slong;&slong;ebok hu&ydot; gonne take
Þe bok wa&slong; iclo&slong;ed fa&slong;te to &punctelev; seint f&rabar;unceis Fraunceis hine gan vndo
Al onmundliche he ondude þe bok &punctelev; and þe fur&slong;te þat he cam to
Þat wa&slong; a god&slong;pel þat &slong;eith &punctelev; ȝif þou wolt parfijt beo
Sul al þi guod and ȝif pouere men &punctelev; and &slong;ethþe &slong;iwe me
¶ Al vnMundlingue vnmundlingue he cam eft&slong;one &punctelev; to a god&slong;pel þat &slong;eide
Þat man ne &slong;cholde &slong;eluer ne gold &punctelev; bi þe weie lede
Þe þ&rrot;idde t&ydot;me al onMundlingue onmundlingue &punctelev; þe ma&slong;&slong;ebok he wende
Þo cam he opon þis god&slong;pel &punctelev; a&slong;e o&rrot;e louerd him g&rabar;ce grace &slong;ende
ho&slong;o wole come after me &punctelev; him&slong;ulf he &slong;chal fo&rrot;&slong;ake
And is owene rode bere &punctelev; and þoene wei after me &slong;o take
¶Þov i&slong;uxt here quath seint Seint
f&rabar;unceis Fraunceis &punctelev; hou o&rrot;e louerd in a &slong;tounde

Þat aftur frere Bernard þe o&rrot;d&rrot;e nam &punctelev; and &slong;ethþe oþur þreo
So þat vnder heom alle sixe frere&slong; &punctelev; togadere weren ib&rrot;ouȝt
And þei þis o&rrot;d&rrot;e were imaud &punctelev; iconfermed na&slong; heo nouȝt

To conf&combtildevert;mi confermi is o&rrot;d&rrot;e ariȝht &punctelev; toward Rome he wende

Ake fo&rrot;th he wende to fondi &punctelev; he nolde nouȝt beo bih&ydot;nde
And euere he bad Ih&combcurl;u Ihesu
cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; þat he mo&slong;te &slong;om g&rabar;ce gra>ce finde
¶Þo þouȝte him in a wi&slong;ion &punctelev; þat
he i&slong;aiȝ a gret treo
So heiȝ þat he wa&slong; ad&rrot;ad &punctelev; toward þe coppe iseo
And nethele&slong; on aunture he him dude &punctelev; and nam þarof a bovȝ
Aboue in þe hexte &slong;tude &punctelev; and toward him it d&rrot;ovȝ
hit beiȝ al adoun to him &punctelev; aftur is wille inovȝ
Fo&rrot; al þat him d&rrot;adde fur&slong;t &punctelev; þat it wa&slong; heiȝ and tovȝ
¶Þo þis holie man awok &punctelev; on þi&slong; sweuene he þouȝte longue
And þareþo&rrot;uȝ he hopede of þe pope &punctelev; &slong;um g&rabar;ce grace fo&rrot;to afongue
Fo&rrot; þe treo þat wa&slong; &slong;o heiȝ &punctelev; lijȝthtliche to grounde d&rrot;ovȝ
Al&slong;o he hopede þene heiȝe pope &punctelev; to is wille b&rrot;ingue inovȝ
To þe pope Innocent &punctelev; þo he to Rome cam
he bad graunti is Religion religion &punctelev; to amendi c&combtildevert;&slong;tindam Cristindam
At Ant þat he &slong;cholde is o&rrot;d&rrot;e p&rrot;eouen &punctelev; and is Revle also
Þo&rrot;uȝ þe god&slong;pel of gode&slong; Godes wo&rrot;d &punctelev; and þeraftur do
¶Þo þe pope i&slong; Revle i&slong;eiȝ &punctelev; þat heo wa&slong; clene and guod
And ope þe god&slong;pelle ifounded al &punctelev; a&slong;e he wel onder&slong;tod
In is herte he g&rabar;untede grauntede it &punctelev; ake nouȝt with is Mouth mouth anon
Fo&rrot; he mo&slong;te is cardinale&slong; &punctelev; conseili þareuppe echon
¶So þat aMong among þis Cardinale&slong; cardinales &punctelev; coun&slong;eil þere wa&slong; inome
Some heolden þare aȝein &punctelev; and al&slong;o þare with some
Þo wa&slong; þer a Cardinal cardinal &punctelev; þat Bi&slong;chop bischop wa&slong; also
Mai&slong;ter Iohan of seint Seint
poul Poul &punctelev; þat fa&slong;te heold þerto
And &slong;eide ȝif we de&slong;tourbieth him &punctelev; aȝein þe god&slong;pelle we beothþ
Ȝwane he &slong;pechut al vpe gode&slong; Godes wo&rrot;d &punctelev; a&slong;e we wel i&slong;eothþ
¶In Avi&slong;ioun avisioun to þe pope &punctelev; a niȝht al&slong;o it cam
Þat he g&rabar;untede grauntede him is Reule &punctelev; to &slong;aui c&combtildevert;&slong;tindom Cristindom
So þat þe pope g&rabar;untede grauntede him &punctelev; al i&slong; Reule to do
And confermede þo&rrot;uȝ al þe court &punctelev; and bihiet him mo&rrot;e þerto
Þo wende fo&rrot;thþ þis holie Man man &punctelev; and i&slong; frere&slong; withþ him nam
And p&rrot;echede aboute þe god&slong;pelle&slong; &punctelev; to amendi c&combtildevert;&slong;tindom Cristindom
¶Þo þe contreiȝe i&slong;eiȝ heom fer&slong;t &punctelev; gret &slong;peche wa þere
Some &slong;eiden þat Auntecri&slong;t &punctelev; oþur is de&slong;ciple&slong; it were
So þat in wel manie &slong;tude&slong; &punctelev; lu&ydot;te guod men heom &slong;ende
And hu&ydot; weren ofte ofhungrede &slong;o&rrot;e &punctelev; a&slong;e hu&ydot; aboute wende
So þat hu&ydot; comen into a &slong;tude &punctelev; and ofhungrede weren &slong;o&rrot;e
Þat &slong;ome of þe freres hadden iþouȝt &punctelev; in þe o&rrot;d&rrot;e to beo no&combmacr; non mo&rrot;e
·18· Ffra... 18 44
Þo cam þere a wel fair man &punctelev; and b&rrot;ouȝte heom mete inovȝ
Sone hu&ydot; nu&slong;ten ȝware he bicam &punctelev; ne ȝwoderward he d&rrot;ovȝ
Þis frere&slong; i&slong;eiȝen fule þo &punctelev; þat an Aungel aungel it wa&slong;
Þe &slong;tudefa&slong;to&rrot;e in heo&rrot;e o&rrot;d&rrot;e &punctelev; hu&ydot; weren fo&rrot; þis cas
And bihieten god God þat hu&ydot; nolden neuere &punctelev; fo&rrot; mi&slong;ei&slong;e ne fo&rrot; wo
In þe o&rrot;d&rrot;e bi heo&rrot;e miȝhte &punctelev; pouerte furgo
¶Bi&slong;ide þe toun of A&slong;i&slong;e &punctelev; feo&rrot; fram eche &slong;trete
hu&ydot; wenden alle to one &slong;tude &punctelev; þat wa&slong; al furlete
Mi&slong;e&ydot;&slong;e hu&ydot; hadden þare inovȝ &punctelev; and ofte wepen &slong;o&rrot;e
Fo&rrot; defaute of heo&rrot;e &slong;u&slong;tinaunce &punctelev; and fo&rrot; defaute of boke&slong; mo&rrot;e
Fo&rrot; hu&ydot; ne hadde boke&slong; none &punctelev; ȝwareon hu&ydot; miȝhten loke
In þe croiz hu&ydot; biheolden al da&ydot; &punctelev; in&slong;tude of heo&rrot;e boke
And beden guod God ȝif it were is wille &punctelev; þat he &slong;cholde heom &slong;um guod teche
Fo&rrot; hu&ydot; nadden non oþur bok &punctelev; ne nu&slong;ten ȝwarewith an&ydot; areche
¶To &slong;einte Seinte
Marie in de&slong;ert &punctelev; þanne&slong; hu&ydot; gunne iwiende
A&slong;e hu&ydot; bigunnen fur&slong;t þe o&rrot;d&rrot;e &punctelev; to b&rrot;ingue a&slong; þare to ende
Seint frauncei&slong; Fraunceis wende bi þe londe &punctelev; and p&rrot;echede aboute þere
Men wenden þo hu&ydot; &slong;eiȝen him fur&slong;t &punctelev; þat of an oþur wo&rrot;lde he were
Fo&rrot; he capede euere upward &punctelev; toward heouene an heiȝ
Þat men wond&rrot;eden and &slong;peken þarof &punctelev; euerech þat him i&slong;eiȝ
Manie heolden him a truant &punctelev; of þe deuele&slong; lo&rrot;e
And harleden him here and þer &punctelev; and ofte beten him &slong;o&rrot;e
Þi&slong; holie man ne tok none ȝeme &punctelev; ake c&combtildevert;ede criede o&rrot;e louerde&slong; o&rrot;e
And ȝware men duden him me&slong;t &slong;chame &punctelev; þudere he d&rrot;ovȝ þe mo&rrot;e
¶Idel ne kepte he neuere beo &punctelev; he ne louede no þin þing &slong;o lu&ydot;te
Ne hatede &slong;o muche a&slong;e he dude Ai&slong;e aise &punctelev; and idelne&slong;&slong;e and p&rrot;u&ydot;te
Frere A&slong;&slong;e a&slong;&slong;e he cleopede is owene fle&slong;ch &punctelev; fo&rrot; ȝe wuten wel þat an A&slong;&slong;e a&slong;&slong;e
Nabbe heo neuere &slong;o lu&ydot;te mete &punctelev; is trauail nis no þe la&slong;&slong;e
Fo&rrot; heo i&slong; iharled here and þere &punctelev; and to file weo&rrot;ke ido
Ip&rrot;iked and iscourget eke &punctelev; and &slong;acke&slong; heo berez al&slong;o
Of ȝeomere þingue heo is ifed &punctelev; ȝwane heo alle&slong; comez þarto
And &slong;elde heo is icoure&ydot;d wel &punctelev; withuovte nail an scho
¶He &slong;eruede &slong;o is owene fle&slong;ch &punctelev; and cleopede it frere A&slong;&slong;e a&slong;&slong;e
Mete he ȝaf him lu&ydot;te inov &punctelev; and to cloþingue wel la&slong;&slong;e
he p&rrot;ikede al&slong;o and &slong;courgede ek &punctelev; and þo&rrot;uȝout þe contreiȝe
harlede it and deope wod &punctelev; barefot in deope we&ydot;e
Ȝwane he i&slong;aiȝ ani idel Man man &punctelev; þat louede glotonie
And ne trauailede nouȝt fo&rrot; is mete &punctelev; he cleopede him frere flie
Fo&rrot; þe flie ne doth non oþur guod &punctelev; bote fleoth feo&rrot; and neo&rrot;
And awa&ydot;tez ȝwane men goth to mete &punctelev; oþur to heo&rrot;e &slong;oper
Anon &slong;o þe Di&slong;ch disch i&slong; i&slong;et adoun &punctelev; heo wole beo ope þe b&rrot;erde
Of t&rabar;uail trauail ne wo ne kephþ kepthþ heo nouȝt &punctelev; bote þat heo wel ferde
¶Ȝwane a Man man hath al dai i&slong;wounke &punctelev; þei he it hadde i&slong;wo&rrot;e
he ne &slong;chal to is Di&slong;ch disch come &slong;o &slong;one &punctelev; þat þe flie nele beo bifo&rrot;e
¶Al&slong;o farez manie idele Men men &punctelev; þat non oþ&combtildevert; þer guod nelleth do
·18·
Bote ȝwanne oþur Men men beth toward þe mete &punctelev; ȝare hu&ydot; beth þarto
Atþe Di&slong;che dische hu&ydot; wollez al&slong;o &slong;one beo &punctelev; a&slong;e hu&ydot; þat habbez iswounke
And þanne is al heo&rrot;e weo&rrot;k ido &punctelev; habben hu&ydot; iȝete and id&rrot;onke
Þanne gothþ hu&ydot; ligge slepe &punctelev; oþur gothþ to &slong;ome folie
Þarefo&rrot;e &slong;eint Seint
fraunce&ydot;&slong; Fraunceys cleopede &punctelev; swuche men frere flie
¶Of noþing nas þis holie man &punctelev; &slong;o glad a&slong;e of edwijȝt
Fo&rrot; ȝwane ani Man man opb&rrot;aid is pouerte &punctelev; he wa&slong; in gret deliȝt
Ȝwane Men men cleopeden him hoxtare &punctelev; oþur cheo&rrot;l oþur cheo&rrot;le&slong; sone
Fo&rrot; po&rrot;t Men men beoth ofte boi&slong;tou&slong;e &punctelev; and hoxtare&slong; bi wone
leue b&rrot;oþer he &slong;eide &punctelev; certes þov &slong;ei&slong;t sothþ
Ible&slong;&slong;ed beo þou fo&rrot; þat wo&rrot;d &punctelev; and alle þat &slong;o dothþ
Pre&slong;es Perses &slong;one Bernard &punctelev; it bicomethþ bi riȝthe lawe
To heo&rrot;e telle of is riȝhte &punctelev; ich auchȝte beo glad and fawe.
And ȝwane men p&rrot;ei&slong;eden ouȝt of is cu&ydot;nde &punctelev; he nadde þareof no deliȝt
Þarefo&rrot;e ho&slong;o wolde him pa&ydot;e &punctelev; segge him &slong;um edwiȝt
And bifo&rrot;e al folk ab&rrot;od &punctelev; in is p&rrot;echingue he &slong;eide
his Mi&slong;ei&slong;e miseise and is defaute &punctelev; ofte and is w&rrot;echhede
¶In po&ydot;le Poyle
&slong;eint Seint
fraunceis Fraunceis ȝeode &punctelev; &slong;ome time ouer lond
So þat a po&rrot;&slong;ful of pane&slong; &punctelev; bi þe weie he fond
he ne tok non mo&rrot;e ȝeme þareto &punctelev; þane to &slong;o muche fen
his felawe bad him nimen heom up &punctelev; and dele pouere men
I nelle nouȝt &slong;eide &slong;eint Seint
f&rabar;unceis Fraunceis &punctelev; of oþur manne&slong; dele
Meþunchez &slong;eide is felawe þo &punctelev; þat þov nart nouȝt fele
Þat þou ne loue&slong;t nouȝt pouere men &punctelev; ȝwane þou nelt heom don no guod
Þis holie man iheo&rrot;de þis &punctelev; and one ȝwile in þouȝte &slong;tod
¶Þou &slong;chalt he &slong;eide &slong;one i&slong;eo &punctelev; ȝat ȝwat þis pane&slong; beoth echon
he wende and nam up þat po&rrot;s &punctelev; and openede him anon
Þo crep þare out a nadd&rrot;e &punctelev; þe foule&slong;te þat miȝhte gon
And þe po&rrot;&slong; al amti wa&slong; &punctelev; and peni bilefte non
And þat wa&slong; þe Deuel of helle &punctelev; þat in þe fourme of pane&slong; la&ydot;
Fo&rrot;to bitra&ydot;⁁e þis holie man &punctelev; ȝwane he þe pane&slong; i&slong;aiȝ
¶Þis holie Man man
seint Seint
f&rabar;unceis Fraunceis &punctelev; among ech manere be&slong;t
Muche he louede ȝoungue lamb&rrot;e &punctelev; and anourede heom euere me&slong;t
Fo&rrot; o&rrot;e louerd euenede him&slong;ulf to a lomb &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ &slong;eint Seint
Iohan þe Bapti&slong;t
And fo&rrot; it is withoute felonie &punctelev; and milde a&slong;e ih&combcurl;u Ihesu
cri&slong;t Crist
And ofte ȝwane men wolden heom quelle &punctelev; fram deþe he heom b&rrot;ouȝte
With biddingue and with is faire wo&rrot;d &punctelev; and fale &slong;iþe&slong; heom bouȝte
¶In þe Abbe&ydot;e abbeye of seint Seint
verecunde Verecunde &punctelev; a ȝoung lomb he founde
A &slong;ouwe a&slong;trangli it anon &punctelev; and fret it in a &slong;tounde
Seint fraunceis Fraunceis &slong;tod and biheold &punctelev; Among among alle be&slong;tes he &slong;eide
Aco&rrot;&slong;ed þou beo luþere &slong;ouwe &punctelev; þat dude&slong;t þis luþere dede
Þat þi lijf beo &slong;cho&rrot;t and &slong;trong &punctelev; and þi dethþ beo &slong;trong al&slong;o
And þat no þing ne ete of þi fle&slong;ch &punctelev; ȝwane þou ert of liue ido
Þo bigan þe souwe anon &punctelev; a&slong;e he þis wo&rrot;d &slong;eide
To beo ful of schabbe and of bu&ydot;le&slong; &punctelev; and of oþur w&rrot;echhede
·18· Ffra... F 18 45
Þat heo o&rrot;n out al of quiture &punctelev; and a&slong;e þat folk i&slong;aiȝ
In w&rrot;echhede and in &slong;o&rrot;ewe inov &punctelev; heo deide þane þ&rrot;idde da&ydot;
And furrotede and &slong;tonk foule inovȝ &punctelev; no be&slong;t þat it i&slong;eiȝ
Rauon ne pie no oþur foul &punctelev; nolde ene&slong; come þareneiȝ
¶Fo&rrot; &slong;eint Seint
fraunceis Fraunceis louede loamb&rrot;e &punctelev; a&slong;e al þat folk isaiȝ
On of is freond fo&rrot; gode&slong; Godes loue &punctelev; a lomb him ȝef a da&ydot;ȝ
Þis lomb wolde old and ȝoung &punctelev; al dai neiȝ him beo
And maken with him Io&ydot;e ioye inouȝ &punctelev; ȝwanne it him miȝhte iseo
Seint f&rabar;unceis Fraunceis hiet þis &slong;chep a da&ydot; &punctelev; ȝwanne it heo&rrot;de frere&slong; &slong;ingue
To churche gon at eche tide &punctelev; and ne lete fo&rrot; none þingue
Þat &slong;chep aftur þulke time &punctelev; selde wolde abide
Ȝwane hit iheo&rrot;de frere&slong; in þe queo&rrot; &punctelev; þat hit na&slong; at eche tide
Blete it wolde aȝene&slong; heom &punctelev; fo&rrot; it ne couþe nouȝt elle&slong; do
And ȝwane it &slong;aiȝ þe frere&slong; &slong;itten akneo &punctelev; kneuli it wolde al&slong;o
And ȝwane ani p&rrot;eo&slong;t &slong;acrede &punctelev; kneoli it wolde þarto
And wel inwardliche biholde þudere &punctelev; a&slong;e it &slong;aiȝ oþur frere&slong; do
Wel auȝte we onouri þe &slong;acringue &punctelev; ȝwane a &slong;wuch be&slong;t wolde
A wonder bedeman it wa&slong; &punctelev; to come to gode&slong; Godes
⁁⁁ &slong;eruice &slong;o bolde"seruice so" added in a later hand.
¶A&slong;e &slong;eint Seint
fraunceis Fraunceis þis holie man &punctelev; ouer lond ofte him d&rrot;ouȝ
Wilde foule&slong; &slong;male and grete &punctelev; honoureden him inovȝ
Fo&rrot; a&slong;e he wende in a t&ydot;me &punctelev; to p&combtildevert;chie prechie p&rrot;echie ouer lond
An hep of foule&slong; grete inovȝ &punctelev; In in a &slong;tude he fond
hu&ydot; &slong;onguen and maden no&ydot;&slong;e inov &punctelev; eu&combtildevert;ech euerech in is wi&slong;e
Þe ȝu&ydot;t þe holie man among heom cam &punctelev; hu&ydot; nolden nouȝt ene&slong; ari&slong;e
¶Beu frere quath þis holie Man man &punctelev; o&rrot;e &slong;u&slong;tren þat beoth here
honourieth god God þat heom made &punctelev; ech in his manere
Riȝht is þat we don al&slong;o &punctelev; are we fram heom gon
hu&ydot; gonne to &slong;egge heo&rrot;e tidene &punctelev; among þi&slong; foule&slong; echon·
¶Þo maden þis foule&slong; &slong;o gret noi&slong;e &punctelev;
þat hu&ydot; ne miȝhten noþing here
So&slong;trene quath þi&slong; holie Man man &punctelev; chaungiez eouwer manere
Beothþ nouþe &slong;tille and latehþ me &slong;egge &punctelev; mine tidene with mi frere
And &slong;ethþe ȝe mouwen aftur u&slong; &punctelev; euerech with is fere
¶Þis foule&slong; anonriȝht to i&slong; he&slong;te &punctelev; &slong;tille weren also
And &slong;eten and heo&rrot;den heo&rrot;e tidene &punctelev; fo&rrot;to hu&ydot; hadden al ido
Nou &slong;u&slong;tren quath þis holie man &punctelev; we habbuthþ i&slong;eid o&rrot;e tide
Bigu&ydot;nnez ouwer ȝwane ȝe wollez &punctelev; ȝe ne þo&rrot;uen no leng abide
Þis foules bigonne &slong;ingue anon &punctelev; þe le&slong;te and eke þe me&slong;te
Swiþe gret pouwer he hadde of god God &punctelev; þat foule&slong; weren at is he&slong;te
¶Þis holie man wende him fo&rrot;th &punctelev; to p&combtildevert;chi prechi ouer lond
A gret hep eft&slong;one of foule&slong; &punctelev; in on oþur &slong;tude he fond
he wende fo&rrot;thþ among heom &punctelev; þi&slong; foule&slong; bigonne echon
Louten to him wel mildeliche &punctelev; and honouri him anon
Þis holie Man man at&slong;tod ane ȝwile &punctelev; and þouȝte heom &slong;um guod teche
And riȝht a&slong;e it weren men of witte &punctelev; þi&slong; foule&slong; he gan to p&rrot;eche
¶Leoue &slong;o&slong;trene he &slong;eide fo&rrot; gode&slong; Godes loue &punctelev; honouriethþ o&rrot;e creaturThe word "loue" has damage to or an erasure of the first two letters, and the "lo" seems to have been added by the same later hand found in line 327. The original text may have been inadvertently erased since the "w" of "witte" in the preceding line appears to have been written over an original "y".
Fo&rrot; among alle liue&slong; &punctelev; ȝe auȝten him don honour
·18·
Fo&rrot; he ȝifht eov nobleie inouȝ &punctelev; w&ydot;nguene fo&rrot;to fleo
And feþerene to beren eov upon heiȝ &punctelev; wide fo&rrot;to &slong;eo
And mete ȝware ȝe wollez aliȝhte &punctelev; withoute echemanere &slong;u&ydot;nche
he ȝifth eov al&slong;o muche p&rrot;u&ydot;te and a&ydot;&slong;e &punctelev; a&slong;e ȝe mouwen onne þenche
Delue ne diki ne þo&rrot;ue ȝe naþur &punctelev; a&slong;e manie Men men moten do
And ȝeot ȝe mouwen habbe mete inovȝ &punctelev; ȝwane oþere nabbeth nouȝt so
¶Þis foules heo&rrot;keneden him wel &slong;tille &punctelev; þe ȝwile is p&rrot;echingue ila&slong;te
And fram wode&slong; and fram oþur &slong;tude&slong; &punctelev; þuderwo&rrot;d d&rrot;owen fa&slong;te
Þo þis holie man hadde ido &punctelev; he wende fo&rrot;th anon
And biteiȝte heom ihe&slong;u Ihesu
cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; and ble&slong;&slong;ede heom echon
he pleide with heom murie inouȝ &punctelev; a&slong;e he among heom gan gon
And &slong;trokede heom with is longue fleue &punctelev; þere nolde ari&slong;e nouȝt on
Are he wolde bidden heom wende fo&rrot;th &punctelev; ȝware hu&ydot; hadden to done
Þis foules þo hu&ydot; heo&rrot;den þis &punctelev; hu&ydot; flouwen fo&rrot;th wel &slong;one
¶Seint f&rabar;unceis Funceis among al oþur þingue &punctelev; riȝht at is heo&rrot;te grounde
Ofte he þouȝte deope inovȝ &punctelev; of o&rrot;e louerde&slong; wounden
So &slong;tudefa&slong;tliche in is þouȝt &punctelev; non oþur þing he ne nam
hit bifeol at þe holie rodetid &punctelev; þat aȝein MiȝhelMa&slong;&slong;e Miȝhelma&slong;&slong;e cam
Opon þe hul of Auuerne &punctelev; a&slong;e it wa&slong; o&rrot;e louerde&slong; wille
Al one in is o&rrot;e&slong;one&slong; &punctelev; þere he lai wel &slong;tille
he þouȝte on o&rrot;e louerde&slong; woundene &punctelev; so deope þat it na&slong; non ende
An Aungel aungel he i&slong;aiȝ an heiȝ &punctelev; riȝht fram heouene wiende
¶Six wingene him þouȝte he hadde &punctelev; þat &slong;chinden b&rrot;iȝhte and wide
Þe tweie &slong;toden up abouen is heued &punctelev; and þe tweien bi is &slong;ide
And þo&rrot;uȝout ouer i&slong; wombe acreo&ydot;z &punctelev; tweien þere weren al&slong;o
A&slong;e men &slong;eothþ ofte in churche depeint &punctelev; ho&slong;o lokethþ þareto
Þe Arme&slong; armes weren along i&slong;p&rrot;ad &punctelev; a&slong;e hu&ydot; weren on þe rode
And þe fet i&slong;treitht along &punctelev; al vrninde ablode
Þo&rrot;uȝ þe riȝht &slong;ide he wa&slong; i&slong;mite &punctelev; and þo&rrot;uȝ fet and honde
hit wa&slong; in fourme of an Aungel aungel &punctelev; o&rrot;e louerd ich onder&slong;tonde
¶ So gret Io&ydot;e ioye hadde þis holie Man man &punctelev; of þis noble &slong;iȝhte
Þat him þouȝte he wa&slong; in an oþur wo&rrot;ld &punctelev; and þonkede gode&slong; Godes miȝhte
he nu&slong;te ȝwat fo&rrot; Io&ydot;e ioye do &punctelev; þe ȝw&ydot;le he þis fourme i&slong;eiȝh
At þe la&slong;te he fleuȝ aȝein &punctelev; into heouene an heiȝh
Seint f&rabar;aunceis Fraunceis wa&slong; in Io&ydot;e ioye inouȝ &punctelev; fo&rrot; he hadde þat noble &slong;iȝth
And nameliche of o&rrot;e louerde&slong; wounden &punctelev; þat he wilnede daiȝ and n&ydot;ȝht
Þo biheold he is owene hondene &punctelev; and is fiet al&slong;o
Þo weren hu&ydot; þo&rrot;uȝout ismite &punctelev; and þe naile&slong; þaron ido
And is riȝht &slong;ide iwounded al&slong;o &punctelev; ake wel &slong;o&rrot;e neren hu&ydot; nouȝt
So þat he hadde þe woundene him&slong;ulf &punctelev; þat &slong;o muche weren in is þouȝt
¶Þe naile&slong; weren blake inouȝ &punctelev; þe hauedene rounde and grete
Þe po&ydot;nte&slong; weren euelongue &punctelev; a&slong;e hu&ydot; weren aȝei[n]wardibete
Aboute þe naile&slong; þat fle&slong;ch &slong;tod up &punctelev; a&slong;e it were altoswolle
And a&slong;e it al aboute were &punctelev; fo&rrot; Angu&ydot;&slong;e anguyse
tobolle
In þis manere we mouwen beo &slong;ikere &punctelev; þat o&rrot;e louerdes woundene were

Fo&rrot; bote a&slong;e a &slong;chewingue and An&slong;aumple ansaumple &punctelev; in &slong;eint Seint
fraunce&ydot;&slong;e Fraunceyse e hu&ydot; nere
So þat þis holie man hadde &punctelev; o&rrot;e louerdes woundene fiue
And bilefden on him afturward &punctelev; þe ȝwile he wa&slong; aliue
At þe holie rodetid in septemb&rrot;e Septembre &punctelev; he gan fur&slong;t þis þing iseo
Ac ope þe hulle he hadde er &punctelev; neiȝ a monþe ibeo
And fourtene niȝt þareafturward &punctelev; he bilefte ȝu&ydot;t þere
So þat euene vnder al &punctelev; fourti dawe&slong; þere were
¶A&slong;e Mo&ydot;&slong;es opon &slong;&ydot;na&ydot; Synay &punctelev; was bi olde dawe
Fourti daiȝe&slong; in p&rrot;iuete &punctelev; to &slong;eon þe olde lawe
Al&slong;o wa&slong; þis holie Man man &punctelev; fourti dawe&slong; riȝht
Opon þe hulle of Auuerne &punctelev; to &slong;eo þat holie &slong;iȝht
So þat Aboute aboute Miȝhelma&slong;&slong;e &punctelev; fur&slong;t he wende to grounde
Ac he hudde is fet and hondene fa&slong;te &punctelev; þat Men men ne i&slong;eiȝen þe wounde
With þe woundene he liuede two ȝer &punctelev; and p&rrot;echede aboute wide
And þe woundene o&rrot;nen ofte ablode &punctelev; and nameliche of is side
And bibledde is cu&ydot;rtel ofte &punctelev; and i&slong; b&rrot;iech al&slong;o
he carede muche hou he miȝhte &punctelev; &slong;tilleliche it awei do
¶Sethþe þare cam in þe londe &punctelev; a Sw&ydot;þe &slong;trong qualm of o&rrot;ue
Þat schep and reoþeren and oþur be&slong;tes &punctelev; al dai leiȝen a&slong;to&rrot;ue
A guod Man man þat hadde muchel o&rrot;f &punctelev; bad o&rrot;e louerd wel fa&slong;te
Þat he ne binome him nouȝt al is guod &punctelev; ake þat &slong;om him mo&slong;te ila&slong;te
Slepinde in ametingue &punctelev; to him &slong;eide þo&rrot;uȝ gode&slong; Godes &slong;onde
Þat he &slong;cholde nime of þat watur &punctelev; þat seint Seint
fraunceis Fraunceis wu&slong;ch inne is honde
Oþur is fet and þerewith &punctelev; among þe be&slong;te&slong; &slong;p&rrot;enge
And ȝif him þouȝte þare were to lu&ydot;te &punctelev; with oþur watur it Mienge mienge
¶Þis guode Man man þareafturward &punctelev; awaitede is point ofte
And &slong;tal of þis watur &slong;tilleliche &punctelev; in hu&ydot;dele&slong; wel &slong;ofte
And &slong;p&rrot;einde among is owene o&rrot;f &punctelev; and among oþure mani on
And oueral þare it wa&slong; i&slong;p&rrot;eind &punctelev; hu&ydot; weren hole echon.
¶Seint fraunceis Fraunceis wa&slong; frere Menour menour &punctelev; in þe o&rrot;d&rrot;e twenti ȝer
And two ȝer and alme&slong;t þ&rrot;eo w&ydot;ke &punctelev; o&rrot;e louerde&slong; woundene he ber
So þat he d&rrot;ouȝ toward þe deþe &punctelev; and febli&slong;chede ful &slong;wiþe fa&slong;te
On him na&slong; nouȝt bote fel and bon &punctelev; bileued atþe la&slong;te
In to&rrot;ment he wa&slong; &slong;trong inovȝ &punctelev; and ȝwane he wa&slong; in wo&rrot;&slong;t &slong;tounde
his lene bone&slong; he wolde d&rrot;awe &punctelev; aȝein þe harde grounde
Fo&rrot;to make þe mo&rrot;e is pine &punctelev; and þe eo&rrot;þe he cu&slong;te also
And þonkede god God of alle guode &punctelev; þat he him hadde ido
he la&ydot; &slong;ijk and deide &slong;one &punctelev; seint frauncei&slong; Fraunceis þe holie man
In o&rrot;e leu⁁edi churche &punctelev; þare he fur&slong;t þe o&rrot;d&rrot;e bigan
¶Þo he wa&slong; þe deþe neiȝ &punctelev; naked he liet him do
And to þe harde v&rrot;þe al bar &punctelev; al nakede he la&ydot; so
And het heom þat aboute him were &punctelev; þat aftur þulke &slong;tounde
hu&ydot; leten him ligge longue al&slong;o &punctelev; nakede on þe grounde
Þat eo&rrot;þe miȝhte on eo&rrot;þe deiȝe &punctelev; fo&rrot; þat were i&slong; riȝhte
he bigan to p&rrot;echi is b&rrot;eþ&rrot;en &punctelev; ope is feble miȝhte
Ffraunceys amen 19
¶Atþe la&slong;te þo he þene dethþ i&slong;aiȝ &punctelev; and ifelde hine ful &slong;trongue
Voce mea he bigan &punctelev; one &slong;aume he of eue&slong;ongue
And &slong;eide fo&rrot;thþ þe saume al out &punctelev; and heold up is hondene heiȝe
And with þe la&slong;te wo&rrot;d of þe saume &punctelev; he bigan to deiȝe
he deide tweolf hund&rrot;ed ȝer &punctelev; and &slong;ixe and twenti riȝht
Aftur o&rrot;e louerdes burtime &punctelev; on a saturda&ydot; Saturday at niȝht
Þe sonendai Sonendai he wa&slong; ibured &punctelev; he ne ferde nouȝt a&slong;e þis riche
Þat fo&rrot; bobaunt of þe wo&rrot;ld &punctelev; liggethþ longue aliche
¶Þo þis holie man was ded &punctelev; þei it were bi niȝhte
A gret hep of lauerkene &punctelev; opon þe churche aliȝhte
And murie &slong;ounguen al þe longue niȝht &punctelev; aboute þe bodie þere
Þo þe soule to heouene wende &punctelev; aȝein ku&ydot;nde þei it were
Fo&rrot; þe lauerke is a foul &punctelev; þat muche louez liȝht
And herethþ þane dai with hire song &punctelev; and re&slong;tez hire aniȝht
Aȝein ku&ydot;nde hu&ydot; &slong;ounguen þere &punctelev; a&slong;e þei hu&ydot; hadden in mu&ydot;nde
hou muche he wa&slong; anoured er &punctelev; of foules aȝein ho&rrot;e ku&ydot;nde
¶Frere Au&slong;t&ydot;n þat wa&slong; mini&slong;tre &punctelev; under him ido
Þo þis holie man wa&slong; ded &punctelev; atþe deþe he lai al&slong;o
In þe londe of labour Labour &punctelev; þat feo&rrot; wa&slong; þarebi&slong;ide
Wel longue he lai &slong;pechele&slong; &punctelev; þene dethþ fo&rrot;to abide
And riȝht a&slong;e seint Seint
f&rabar;uncei&slong; Fraunceis deide &punctelev; feo&rrot; in an oþur londe
Þis frere Au&slong;tin &slong;pac wel mildeliche &punctelev; and heold up is two honden
Abijd b&rrot;oþur he &slong;eide ane ȝw&ydot;le &punctelev; ich come with þe anon
his freres axeden him ȝwat it were &punctelev; fo&rrot; heom wond&rrot;ede echon
¶Bote frere frauncei&slong; Fraunceis he &slong;eide o&rrot;e fader &punctelev; ib&rrot;ouȝt hath is lif to ende
And is nouþe toward heouene &punctelev; and with him ichulle wende
With þis wo&rrot;d he gan deiȝe &punctelev; and is &slong;oule al in pes
To þe Io&ydot;e ioye of heouene wende &punctelev; with is mai&slong;ter &slong;eint Seint
f&rabar;uncei&slong; Fraunceis
And þare hu&ydot; boþe beoþ &punctelev; in Io&ydot;e ioye withouten ende
Nou god God fo&rrot; þe loue of seint Seint
